title.narrative: Oxfam IBIS activities in Syria and the region 2019

description.narrative: Oxfam IBIS activities in Syria and the region 2019
FL §06.39.03.11 Other contributions to acute and prolonged crises

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 2. Communities, especially youth and women are increasingly self-reliant (Syria)
70% of targeted farmers, households & youth have increased income and/or reduced negative coping mechanisms (S)
1. Girls, boys, women and men have increased access to protection and basic services including WASH and safe and secure learning spaces

90% of cash for protection or legal aid beneficiaries state the intervention was suitable for their intended need (L) 90% of beneficiaries indicate they have access to safe, reliable and dignified access to water (S & L) 75% of Protection Focal Points, Community Health Volunteers and members of women groups state having increased knowledge and capacities and means to effectively identify and address local level protection and public health threats (L) % increase in girls and boys school attendance in target schools (S)

target.value: 90% of cash for protection or legal aid beneficiaries state the intervention was suitable for their intended need (L) 90% of beneficiaries indicate they have access to safe, reliable and dignified access to water (S & L) 75% of Protection Focal Points, Community Health Volunteers and members of women groups state having increased knowledge and capacities and means to effectively identify and address local level protection and public health threats (L) % increase in girls and boys school attendance in target schools (S)

title.narrative: 3. Syrian and Lebanese civil society increasingly address protection concerns and call upon stakeholders to influence policies
CSOs with increased capacities to design and implement effective and principled humanitarian response CSOs with increased voice to influence the humanitarian agenda in their country

target.value: CSOs with increased capacities to design and implement effective and principled humanitarian response CSOs with increased voice to influence the humanitarian agenda in their country

title.narrative: Syria 1.1 water and sanitation systems have been repaired for 2,500 HHs 1.2 3000 hygiene and gender sensitive kits to children & youth 1.3 70 teachers & students facilitate school hygiene awareness campaigns 1.4 5 community water & sanitation facilities repaired; 5 solid waste clean-up campaigns & WASH facilities in 15 rehabilitated 1.5 School & local authorities have received & maintenance of water, sanitation, waste services

# of community water &sewage facilities repaired # households with access to improved sanitation # households & schools receive hygiene & conservation messaging # hygiene and dignity kits distributed to school children # teachers and students trained & school hygiene clubs established # schools with gender-segregated inclusive/accessible WASH facilities # school staff in rehabilitation of school WASH facilities & efforts to improve hygiene and environmental sanitation # local water authority staff participating in operations and maintenance of water, sanitation and solid waste services and infrastructure

target.value: 1.1 water and sanitation systems have been repaired for 2,500 HHs 1.2 3000 hygiene and gender sensitive kits to children & youth 1.3 70 teachers & students facilitate school hygiene awareness campaigns 1.4 5 community water & sanitation facilities repaired; 5 solid waste clean-up campaigns & WASH facilities in 15 rehabilitated 1.5 School & local authorities have received & maintenance of water, sanitation, waste services

title.narrative: 2.1. Youth received vocational training (200) & transformative skills training (80) + start up kits 2.4 Vulnerable farmers (500) provided with kits and trained in farming techniques and business skills or small livestock/poultry 2.5 3 communal assets rehabilitated via cash for work

# of youth trained in vocational skill& seed grants dispersed # of women/men trained in transformative skills # of households received farming inputs & trained # of communal assets rehabilitated # of cash for work workers receiving cash # policy briefs produced

target.value: 2.1. Youth received vocational training (200) & transformative skills training (80) + start up kits 2.4 Vulnerable farmers (500) provided with kits and trained in farming techniques and business skills or small livestock/poultry 2.5 3 communal assets rehabilitated via cash for work

title.narrative: 3.1 CSO capacities have been trained, coached or and supported for strengthening capacity on programming and local humanitarian leadership 3.2 10 CSO advocacy initiatives supported 3.3 Digital platform to track protection threats (L) 3.4 6 briefs/studies produced
# of CSO staff supported # CSO-led advocacy advocacy initiatives # policy briefs/studies

target.value: 3.1 CSO capacities have been trained, coached or and supported for strengthening capacity on programming and local humanitarian leadership 3.2 10 CSO advocacy initiatives supported 3.3 Digital platform to track protection threats (L) 3.4 6 briefs/studies produced
